comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Dr. Edwin Carman's wife, Florence Conklin Carman, was accused of murdering a Mrs. Lulu Bailey in Dr. Carman's office, in Freeport, June 1914.  She was tried twice:  the first trial ended in a hung jury, the second in her acquittal.  He died in 1939, age 71.
